intro: Pelexia itamarandibana, commonly known as the Itamarandiba pelexia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and is adapted to thrive in shaded, humid environments. It is classified as an endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for ecological and horticultural study.
